law.catch_line: Revocation of authority for failure to pay.
law.text: The commissioner may revoke the certificate of authority of any insurer which fails to pay when due any taxes, fees, licenses, and other charges owing to this state. The commissioner may likewise revoke the license of any agent, surplus lines broker, adjuster, administrator, reinsurance intermediary broker or manager, rental vehicle agent or managing employee, specialty credit producer or managing employee, life settlement broker or provider, or consultant, as to whom any tax or fee required under this code has not been paid when due.
law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 24, sec. 990, effective July 15, 2010. -- Amended 2008 Ky. Acts ch. 32, sec. 12, effective July 15, 2008. -- Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 273, sec. 3, effective July 15, 2002. -- Created 1970, sec. 301, subtit. 4, sec. 4, effective June 18, 1970.
